quote: She built her character with the adversity she had faced, so she could live the best of her life for the rest of life.
author: Nikki Rowe

quote: If we women were particular about men's characters, we should never get married at all.
author: George Bernard Shaw, Heartbreak House

quote: The way you handle your problems shows your character.
author: Kishore Bansal

quote: For it is often the hardest tasks that build the most character.
author: Jody Hedlund, An Uncertain Choice

quote: Quality of work is directly related to the quality of a person's character.
author: Orrin Woodward

quote: The loves of all hearts are so many mirrors revealing their characters.
author: Fulton J. Sheen, Three to Get Married

quote: The sad reality of Mankind: Faith is the currency people trade in, through their ego and selfish ways.
author: Unarine Ramaru
category: character, egocentrism, faith, lifestyle, mankind, morals, selfishness

quote: You can tell a lot about a man's character by how he behaves when given anonymity..
author: Dinesh Kumar Biran

quote: ...you have to believe in its principles. Anything is possible, as long as it's for the good of the world. Make the exception. Live exceptionally. And if you can't do that, maybe we should consider whether you're right for the project. Think about it, then let's talk tomorrow.
author: Amy Tan, The Bonesetter's Daughter

quote: Wisdom along with maturity is self understanding and defining one's character through reasoning in a circumstance.
author: Unarine Ramaru
category: character, circumstance, conduct-of-life-philosophy, maturity, reasoning, self-definition, self-understanding, wisdom

quote: It is with words that my heart sings, with the substance of integrity my character soars and without regret I look back smiling ~bns
author: Bluenscottish

quote: There's never any telling what you'll say or do next, except that it's bound to be something astonishing. By God, sir, you are a character.
author: John Huston, The Maltese Falcon

quote: Even your sweetest character has claws, no matter how well they may be retracted and hidden (hidden even from herself).
author: Eric Maisel Ph.D.

quote: Characters begin as your children and become your teachers.
author: Chloe Thurlow, The Fifty Shades of Grey Phenomena

quote: People like you are the reason this album needed to be written in the first place. When you’ve got your salary, and your cosy little ivory tower, you’re dead happy to spout off about artistic integrity and us getting there together. But the minute you’re asked to back your promises up with some strength of character, you come apart. You say you love good music, but you can’t listen to it that carefully if you treat people like this.
author: Guy Mankowski, How I Left the National Grid: A post-punk novel

quote: You can never go wrong by doing what’s right.
author: Paul T. Clark

quote: If you are to be, you must begin by assuming responsibility.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quote: Besides it's not as though the prisoner can truly die, any more than a character in a novel can. You can always flip back to the first page, can't you?
author: Django Wexler, The Forbidden Library
category: book, books, character, characters, novel, novels, reading, reading-books

quote: He who is of a calm and happy nature will hardly feel the pressure of age. But to him who is of an opposite disposition, youth and age are equally a burden.
author: Plato, The Republic

quote: He could take on anything and everything, it seemed, rather than leave himself time to reflect on his dissatisfaction with his life and what he might do about it.
author: Claire Tomalin, Charles Dickens

quote: But down these mean streets a man must go who is not himself mean, who is neither tarnished nor afraid.
author: Raymond Chandler

quote: Whom one is speaking to - or which aspect of their character - fundamentally determines the meaning and consequences of an exhortation. 'Indulge Your Desires' comes across very differently on a billboard advertising SUVs than it does spray-painted across the broken windows of an SUV dealer. It follows that what you say is not nearly as important as how and when you say it.
author: CrimethInc., Contradictionary
category: anarchism, anarchy, billboards, character, consequences, consumerism, crimethinc, graffiti, speech

quote: Never fall for a person's image and status as the may serve as a false representation of character. Watch closely the character and you"ll know who a person really is.
author: Kemi Sogunle

quote: The truth is that circumstances had done much to cultivate in Mrs. Tristram a marked tendency to irony. Her taste on many points differed from that of her husband, and though she made frequent concessions it must be confessed that her concessions were not always graceful. They were founded upon a vague project she had of some day doing something very positive, something a trifle passionate. What she meant to do she could by no means have told you; but meanwhile, nevertheless, she was buying a good conscience, by installments.
author: Henry James, The American

quote: A man's integrity isn't found in what he does for others, but how he feels about it after it's done.
author: MrFlufferTootle

quote: You have to be tough and stand your ground.
author: Dan Welch, The Kids Are All Right: A Memoir

quote: My characters will happily march off a cliff if it is in them to do so, but may the gods help me if I write that the character is an alcoholic when they are not. They will fight me at every turn and it is their domain. A writer cannot win against a stubborn character.
author: Thomm Quackenbush, Pagan Standard Times: Essays on the Craft

quote: You don't have to drink this," I said, handing him the champagne. "But Sandy might like it"."No,no. Come on, let's have some," he grinned, popping the cork, taking a swig from the bottle and passing it back. He [HST] rarely failed to show his appreciation of someone appreciating him, which is an admirable trait.
author: Jay Cowan
category: appreciation, biography, character, cowan, gonzo, hst, hunter, jay, s, thompson

quote: The real dawah to Islam is the character of a Muslim.
author: Nouman Ali Khan
category: active, allah, character, dawah, integrity, islam, standard, time, youth

quote: Good character is not formed in a week or a month. It is created little by little, day by day. Protracted and patient effort is needed to develop good character.
author: Heraclitus

quote: All of these people had character. None of them thought they were special people, born with the right to win. They were people who worked hard, who learned how to keep their focus under pressure, and who stretched beyond their ordinary abilities when they had to.
author: Carol S. Dweck

quote: Time to improve is limited. The clock is always on and doesn't care if you don't feel like it. Someone else does and they're passing you by.
author: William James Moore, On Character and Mental Toughness

quote: You have to push through every difficulty to have a breakthrough.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: adversity-quotes, challenges-quotes, character, courage-quotes, determined-spirit, difficult-times, difficulties-of-life, hardtimes, strength-of-spirit, strength-through-adversity, working-hard

quote: As the caterpillar undergoes transformation within the cocoon before emerging as a butterfly; likewise, life experiences shape character.
author: Lorna Jackie Wilson, Babygirl

quote: After a sharp inward struggle, he concluded to stay and see it out. He should despise himself, more than he cared to face, if he gave in now.
author: Thomas Hughes, Tom Brown at Oxford

quote: Courage was not something one picked out of the air. It was something like a bank account. You could withdraw only so much before it was necessary to stop, to take the time to make new deposits.
author: Tom Clancy

quote: Allow me to tell you, Mr Taylor," said I, but quietly as the occasion demanded, "that one gentleman does not rejoice at the misfortune of another in public".
author: William Golding

quote: I'm not concerned with whether you got to the top. I want to know how far you climbed. That is where the real achievement is found.
author: William James Moore, On Character and Mental Toughness

quote: The politeness which she had been brought up to practice as a duty made it impossible for her to escape; while the want of that higher species of self-command, that just consideration of others, that knowledge of her own heart, that principle of right which had not formed any essential part of her education, made her miserable under it.
author: Jane Austen

quote: The good polis is made by the good person, his moral character intact, and the good polis, in turn, helps turn out good persons, their moral character intact.
author: Rebecca Goldstein, Plato at the Googleplex: Why Philosophy Won't Go Away

quote: I don't only act out of my character; my character reacts to my actions. Each time I why, even if I'm not caught, I become a little bit more of this ugly thing: a liar. Character is always in the making, with each morally valenced action, whether right or wrong, affecting our characters, the people who we are.
author: Rebecca Goldstein, Plato at the Googleplex: Why Philosophy Won't Go Away

quote: Oh, mercy, there is nothing monstrously ugly about you. Ruth may be unpleasing, but you are merely plain. If anything, it's my beauty that's monstrous, for it sweeps away any other aspect of my character.
author: Gregory Maguire

quote: Virtues are the internal qualities that allow us to be our best selves and enable us to lead complete and fulfilling lives.
author: Jonathan V. Last

quote: You must remember that you cannot form your character in a moment, my dear. Character is a plant of slow growth and the seeds must be planted early.
author: Jean Webster, When Patty Went to College

quote: One of the Christian's biggest fears is appearing 'too Christian'. God forbid, because that's often characterized as god-awful! We want to be one, but without being 'one of them'.
author: Criss Jami, Killosophy
category: afraid, apologetics, awful, character, christian, christianity, church, conservative, criticism, fear, forbid, funny, funny-but-true, god, humor, hypocrisy, judgment, liberal, misrepresentation, modernity, prude, religion, representation, scrutiny, self-righteousness, spirituality, worldly

quote: It's curious that people go wrong so often between inferiority complex and self-confidence. Pitiful isn't it?
author: Öykü Yelkencioğlu
category: character, characterization, complex, inferiority, pitiful, self-confidence

quote: Personal qualities are much more important than qualifications.
author: P.K. Shaw

quote: Character and attitude deficiencies are piercing thorns depending your handhold
author: Angelica Hopes, Landscapes of a Heart, Whispers of a Soul

quote: Existenz only becomes clear through reason
author: reason only has content through Existenz.

quote: Resolute, responsible, determined, knowledgeable, and perceptive
author: Lee Child, A Wanted Man

quote: A man's worth can be judged through those who dislike him.
author: Bill Loguidice

quote: Actions are based on attitues but behaviours based on character
author: pavankumar nagaraj

quote: Don't judge a person by how important he is or how big he is. Judge a person by the strength of character or size of his heart.
author: Glad Munaiseche

quote: Learn from all, but copy none and just be yourself.
author: Innocent Mwatsikesimbe, Mirror

quote: The modern virtues fail because they concern the outer self, the human facade, the part of ourselves the world sees most readily – while the classical virtues form an organizing framework for our inner selves… for our souls.
author: Jonathan V. Last

quote: Love it when a compelling new character kicks open your mental door, tracks mud across your brain, and props their feet up on your cerebrum.
author: Don Roff
category: brain, cerebrum, character, funny, inspiration, love, mental, writing

quote: Every character in a story, I thought when I had folded up the phone, has both a purpose and a secret purpose.
author: Paul Park, All Those Vanished Engines

quote: If you truly have character and respecting others is your core value, you respect everybody regardless of who they are, what they believe and how they behave...
author: Assegid Habtewold, The 9 Cardinal Building Blocks: For Continued Success in Leadership

quote: Don't judge a person by how important he is or how big he is. Judge a person by the strength of his character or size of his heart.
author: Glad Munaiseche

quote: People not only stinks because of the odor but also because of the character.
author: Rashi Bishnoi

quote: I make honorable things pleasant to children." A teacher from Sparta
author: David Brooks

quote: A liar deceives himself more than anyone, for he believes he can remain a person of good character when he cannot.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes
category: character, cheat, deceit, deceitful-people, fib, fibber, liar, lying, richelle, richelle-e-goodrich, richelle-goodrich

quote: Count your years and you'll be ashamed to be wanting and working for exactly the same things as you wanted when you were a boy. Of this one thing make sure against your dying day - that your faults die before you do. Have done with those unsettled pleasures, which cost one dear - they do one harm after they're past and gone, not merely when they're in prospect. Even when they're over, pleasures of a depraved nature are apt to carry feelings of dissatisfaction, in the same way as a criminal's anxiety doesn't end with the commission of the crime, even if it's undetected at the time. Such pleasures are insubstantial and unreliable; even if they don't do one any harm, they're fleeting in character. Look around for some enduring good instead. And nothing answers this description except what the spirit discovers for itself within itself. A good character is the only guarantee of everlasting, carefree happiness. Even if some obstacle to this comes on the scene, its appearance is only to be compared to that of clouds which drift in front of the sun without ever defeating its light.
author: Seneca, Letters from a Stoic

quote: Charisma without character is postponed calamity.
author: Peter Ajisafe

quote: Make no mistake. You are your most important critic and your conscience your most important judge of character.
author: Denis Waitley

quote: The gap between intentions and actions is character.
author: Orrin Woodward

quote: Where your flesh is in front, your future is behind.
author: Paul Enenche

quote: A man should never be judged by his skill, talent, colour, financial or political status, facial beauty and level of education but by the quality of his character.
author: Paul Bamikole
category: beauty, character, colour, education, judge, quality, race, skill, status

quote: Nature evaluates a character on the basis of its merits, not demerits.
author: Raheel Farooq
category: character, good-and-evil, personality, vices, virtue, virtues-and-vices

quote: A leader is not authenticated by title or position, but by character and influence, most important by leading among the pack and not in front.
author: Unarine Ramaru

quote: The character to follow thru on commitments made to others is built by following thru on commitments made to self.
author: Orrin Woodward

quote: For Aristotle, it's not enough simply to act in accordance with the reason once in a while. We must cultivate habits of virtue that develop into a firmly established moral character over a lifetime.
author: John Mark Reynolds, The Great Books Reader: Excerpts and Essays on the Most Influential Books in Western Civilization

quote: We are what we are because of what we've been
author: Jo Beverley

quote: Character isn't all about becoming a saint or perfect. No one is perfect! There are areas we all are working on to improve and fine tune..
author: Assegid Habtewold, The 9 Cardinal Building Blocks: For Continued Success in Leadership

quote: The character of someone shouldn't be measured based on what they eat, drink or the way they dress. Character that commands following is more than demonstrating some 'nice', 'cute', 'appealing' behaviors. It is deeper than that!
author: Assegid Habtewold, The 9 Cardinal Building Blocks: For Continued Success in Leadership

quote: Reason and justice grip the remotest and the loneliest star. Look at those stars. Don’t they look as if they were single diamonds and sapphires? Well, you can imagine any mad botany or geology you please. Think of forests of adamant with leaves of brilliants. Think the moon is a blue moon, a single elephantine sapphire. But don’t fancy that all that frantic astronomy would make the smallest difference to the reason and justice of conduct. On plains of opal, under cliffs cut out of pearl, you would still find a notice-board, “Thou shalt not steal.
author: G.K. Chesterton

quote: You speak of the good conduct of your ancestors. As your own conduct is under discussion, and not theirs, I cannot see how their former good character can at all serve your present purpose. Fortunately for our country, every man stands upon his own merit.
author: Stephen Decatur

quote: • you should improve your character, because it's belong to your destiny ♥
author: Mana'hil

quote: The true test of character is to live win-win even when promoted to positions where win-lose is possible.
author: Orrin Woodward

quote: Graphic designers judge a cover by its book.
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana, N for Nigger: Aphorisms for Grown Children and Childish Grown-ups
category: appearance, book, character, cover, design, graphic-design, graphic-designers, impression, judge, judgement, looks

quote: Excitement about things became a habit, a part of my personality, and the expectation that I should enjoy new experiences often engendered the enjoyment itself.
author: Doris Kearns Goodwin, Wait Till Next Year
category: character, cheerfulness, curiosity, enthusiasm, parenthood, personality

quote: Beauty has a lot to do with character.
author: Kevyn Aucoin

quote: ...I was shocked and astonished when a daring little girl -- a cousin I think -- having waited under a group of trees in the avenue, where she knew [my grandfather] would pass near four o'clock on the way to his dinner, said to him, 'If I were you and you were a little girl, I would give you a doll.
author: W.B. Yeats
category: character, childhood, cute, funny, sass, yeats

quote: Denton struck Charley as the kind of man who never wasted energy on extra movement or idle chitchat. He was foursquare Sonny Boy Williamson and Sister Rosetta Tharpe, a Silvertone guitar, older than old school.
author: Natalie Baszile, Queen Sugar

quote: The problem with human race is not that it errs, but that it does so repetitively.
author: Raheel Farooq
category: character, humans, mankind, mistakes, repentance, repetitiveness, sins

quote: Angela Duckworth has shown how important grit and perseverance are to lifetime outcomes. College students who report that they finish whatever they begin have higher grades than their peers, even ones with higher SATs.
author: David Brooks

quote: But in all His dealings with His creatures God has maintained the principles of righteousness by revealing sin in its true character-by demonstrating that its sure result is misery and death.
author: Ellen G. White, Patriarchs And Prophets
category: character, death, glory, misery, righteousness, sin

quote: WHO WHAT WHERE WHY WHENPersonality redefines character through phases of wisdom at different ages
author: Kamil Ali, Profound Vers-A-Tales
category: ali, character, kamil, kamiltheauthor, personality, phases, philosophy, profound, tales, vers, wisdom

quote: CORE ADOREOur true worth lies in our character, not in our accomplishments
author: Kamil Ali, Profound Vers-A-Tales
category: accomplish, adore, ali, character, core, kamil, kamiltheauthor, philosophy, profound, tales, vers

quote: Character is the main object of education.
author: Mary Wooley

quote: Consider meekness as a character trait to develop and then you will leave a leagcy as a leader who influenced and touched lives.
author: -Shandel Slaten

quote: God does not expect of us what we cannot do, but He does expect what we can do.
author: Kristiane Backer, From MTV to Mecca: How Islam Inspired My Life

quote: Character built out of restrictions and boundaries can be deceiving.Be aware!
author: Mehnaz Ansari

quote: The priest motioned for the congrecation to sit, then welcomed everyone in the name of the Father, Son and Holy Spirit. He wasn't so much thin as soft, with wisps of dull brown hair and oversize glasses that made him look gooberish. As he shook holy water over a bundle of cane stalks leaning against the wall, Charley wondered if his blessing would be powerful enough, because from where she sat, it looked like he'd have trouble asking for extra mayo on his sandwich.
author: Natalie Baszile, Queen Sugar

quote: Characters should be interchangeable as between one book and another. The entire corpus of existing literature should be regarded as a limbo from which discerning authors could draw their characters as required, creating only when they failed to find a suitable existing puppet. The modern novel should be largely a work of reference. Most authors spend their time saying what has been said before – usually said much better. A wealth of references to existing works would acquaint the reader instantaneously with the nature of each character, would obviate tiresome explanations and would effectively preclude mountebanks, upstarts, thimble-riggers and persons of inferior education from an understanding of contemporary literature.
author: Flann O'Brien, At Swim-Two-Birds

quote: The strength of a man is in his character. A strong man is a great man of wisdom who understands, his top priority is to his family.
author: Ellen J. Barrier, The Price We Must Pay for Our Father's Sins
category: character, characteristic-traits, family-man, great-men, moral-values, strong-men, top-priority, wisdom, wise-men

quote: True masters deconstruct as well as reconstruct.
author: Richard Rohr, Adam's Return: The Five Promises of Male Initiation

quote: You fight your superficiality, you shallowness, as as to come at people without unreal expectations, without an overload of bias or hope or arrogance, as untank-like as you can be, sans cannon and machine guns and steel plating half a foot thick; you come at them unmenacingly on your own ten toes instead of tearing up the turf with your caterpillar treads, take them on with an open mind, as equals, man to man, as we used to say, and yet you never fail to get them wrong, you might as well have the brain if a tank. You get them wrong before you meet them, while you're anticipating meeting them; you get them wrong while you're with them; and them you go home to tell somebody else about the meeting and you get them wrong again. Since the same generally goes for them with you, the whole thing is really a dazzling illusion empty of all perception an astonishing farce of misperception. And yet what are we to do about this terribly significant business of other people, which gets bled of the significance we think it has and takes on instead a significance that is ludicrous, so ill equipped are we all to envision one another's interior workings and invisible aims? Is everyone to go off and lock the door and sit secluded like the lonely writers do, in a soundproof cell, summoning people out of words, and then proposing that there word people are closer to the real thing than we mangle with our ignorance every day? The fact remains that getting people right is not what living is all about anyway. It's getting them wrong that is living, getting them wrong and wrong and wrong and then, on careful consideration, getting them wrong again. That's how we know we're alive: we're wrong. Maybe the best thing would be to forget being right or wrong about people and just go along for the ride. But if you can do that - well, lucky you.
author: Philip Roth, American Pastoral

quote: The Character built out of restrictions and boundaries can be deceiving. Be aware!!
author: Mehnaz Ansari

quote: The way a person spends his money and time can tell a lot about the things he or she values.
author: Sarah Tse

quote: Love is not possession, it is acceptance of everything without intention. Fear is not possession, it is acceptance of everything without mention. The act of loving your fear, to nurture this insecurity for a greater purpose, is to accept the reality of ones expression.
author: James C. Emlund
category: character, fear, hardship, love, pain, possession

quote: It takes great character and understanding of human emotions to help someone you shouldn't be helping under normal circumstances.
author: Daya Kudari

quote: Yeah, episodic doesn't work. Your coolest character needs something big and meaningful to do. Otherwise, well, it's just narrative shit.
author: Don Roff
category: character, narrative, shit, writing, writing-process, writing-tips

quote: Character and Professionalism can only be seen when faced with adversity…
author: Thaddeus L Edwards

quote: The beauty of being shattered is how the shards become our character and our marks of distinction.
author: Bryant McGill, Simple Reminders: Inspiration for Living Your Best Life

quote: Nearly every parent on earth operates on the assumption that character matters a lot to the life outcomes of their children. Nearly every government antipoverty program operates on the assumption that it doesn’t.
author: David Brooks

quote: Life is swimming to shore with cowboy boots on.
author: Christopher G. Moore, God Of Darkness

quote: Virtue is what happens when someone has made a thousand small choices requiring effort and concentration to do something which is good and right, but which doesn't come naturally. And then, on the thousand and first time, when it really matters, they find that they do what's required automatically. Virtue is what happens when wise and courageous choices become second nature.
author: N.T. Wright, After You Believe: Why Christian Character Matters

quote: Friendship (as the ancients saw) can be a school of virtue
author: but also (as they did not see) a school of vice. It is ambivalent. It makes good men better and bad men worse.

quote: Forget happiness. You were called to a throne. How will you prepare for it? That is the question of virtue, Christian style.
author: N.T. Wright, After You Believe: Why Christian Character Matters

quote: Successful resistance to temptation may result in an increase of moral muscle, but that is because one is going to need it. A temptation resisted may become more, not less, fierce.
author: N.T. Wright, After You Believe: Why Christian Character Matters

quote: No one ever developed their character by arranging their experiences in such a way that only ‘good’ things are allowed to happen to them. Character is not purchased with a dance in the street. It is not cheap, and it’s hard to come by, owing partly to the fact that it is the heir of disappointment, frustration, betrayal and deceit. However, it is not the inheritance that matters so much as what you do with it. In the face of seemingly insurmountable problems what do you do, and why do you do it? The same holds for dramatic characters whose strength, courage, insight and wisdom have to be earned.
author: Billy Marshall Stoneking
category: betrayal, character, deceit, insights, stoneking, writing

quote: Virtue is what happens when habitual choices have been wise.
author: N.T. Wright, After You Believe: Why Christian Character Matters

quote: The future goal is the thing which produces character in the present.
author: N.T. Wright, After You Believe: Why Christian Character Matters

quote: The only fear that builds character, is the fear of God.
author: Anthony Liccione
category: bring-down, change, character, courage, destruction, fear, god, limits

quote: By myself I am not large enough to call the whole man into activity
author: I want other lights than my own to show all his facets.

quote: God has given to His works His own character of emeth; they are watertight, faithful, reliable, not at all vague or phantasmal.
author: C.S. Lewis, Reflections on the Psalms

quote: When both you and your spouse actively focus on developing godly character qualities, the foundation of your marriage will be twice as strong.
author: Elizabeth George
category: active, author, books, character, christian, faithful, focus, foundation, god, love, marriage, spouse, strong

quote: You find out more of the type of person someone is when they are around someone in need
author: Amanda Penland

quote: Well, I myself, while sometimes unkempt by nights of drunkenness and debauchery, am quite convinced a man’s good character is marked by his impeccable attire.
author: Hal Duncan, Scruffians! Stories of Better Sodomites

quote: Home is our greatest place of trials.
author: Muhammad bin Muhammad
category: character, love, parents, patience, sacrifice, trials

quote: With all due disrespect...
author: Sir Topless Bottomley

quote: Falsehood of a good man is better than truth of a bad one.
author: Raheel Farooq

quote: The fact that God can bring character development and personal growth out of any situation is conditional on people's willingness to submit to God's will. God is sovereign over every life, but those who yield their will to him will be shaped according to his purposes. When God directs a life for his purposes, all of life is a school. No experience, good or bad, is ever wasted (Rom. 8:28). God doesn't squander people's time. He doesn't ignore their pain. He brings not only healing but growth out of even the worst experiences. Every relationship can be God's instrument to mature a person's character.
author: Henry T. Blackaby, Spiritual Leadership: Moving People on to God's Agenda

quote: Oh, I have always been proud, I always wanted all or nothing! You see it was just because I am not one who will accept half a happiness, but always wanted all
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky, The Gentle Spirit
category: character, esteem, happiness, personality, pride, proud, settle

quote: Feeble is the character, that bows to inflated ego, arrogance, and whines of affluent, whilst raising itself mercilessly on the humble and underprivileged.
author: Aniruddha Sastikar
category: affluent, arrogance, bows, character, ego, feeble, humble, insult, mercilessly, poor, rich, underprivileged, weak, wealthy, whining

quote: Sincere and unspiteful laughter is mirth, but where is there any mirth in our time, and do people know how to be mirthful?... A man's mirth is a feature that gives away the whole man, from head to foot. Someone's character won't be cracked for a long time then the man bursts out laughing somehow quite sincerely, and his whole character suddenly opens up as if on the flat of your hand. Only a man of the loftiest and happiest development knows how to be mirthful infectiously, that is, irresistibly and goodheartedly. I'm not speaking of his mental development, but of his character, of the whole man. And so, if you want to discern a man and know his soul, you must look, not at how he keeps silent, or how he speaks, or how we weeps, or even how he is stirred by the noblest ideas, but you had better look at him when he laughs. If a man has a good laugh, it means he's a good man.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky, The Adolescent

quote: The true measure of a person’s character is how one handles one’s failures, not successes.
author: Bill Courtney, Against the Grain: A Coach's Wisdom on Character, Faith, Family, and Love
category: character, failures, handle, measure, person, success, successes, true

quote: Repetition is the mother of character and skill.
author: Rick Warren, The Purpose Driven Life: What on Earth Am I Here for?

quote: She was herself in their company but a very specific version of herself.
author: Sara Sheridan, London Calling

quote: Little choices determine habit
author: Habit carves and molds characterWhich makes the big decisions.
category: Elizabeth George, A Woman's High Calling

quote: How did you act when all was not good? Did you rise to the challenge? Did you display grit, resilience, and integrity in your response? Character isn't about being perfect or always doing the right thing. Character is how you respond to your own failures. It’s when you screw up and life hits you in the mouth that you have an opportunity to reveal your inner strength.
author: Bill Courtney, Against the Grain: A Coach's Wisdom on Character, Faith, Family, and Love
category: against-the-grain, bill-courtney, challenge, character, coach-bill-courtney, how-to, inspirational

quote: You can’t be a successful leader or mentor until you have served. You can’t serve until you have stepped out of your comfort zone. And you can’t step out of your comfort zone unless you have character and keep your word.
author: Bill Courtney, Against the Grain: A Coach's Wisdom on Character, Faith, Family, and Love
category: character, comfort, comfort-zone, faith, leader, leadership, mentor, serve, served, step-out, success, word

quote: You have to be somebody before you can share yourself.
author: Jaron Lanier, You Are Not a Gadget

quote: Standard is not the money you have nor the creed you belong to ,truly IT IS CHARACTER......
author: Zainab Asif

quote: He had just compunction enough for having done nothing for his sisters himself, to be exceedingly anxious that everybody else should do a great deal.
author: Jane Austen, Sense and Sensibility

quote: It took a certain kind of person to come from luxury and seek out danger.
author: Sara Sheridan, London Calling

quote: The larger an English industry was, the more likely it was to go bankrupt, because the English were not naturally corporate people; they disliked working for others and they seemed to resent taking orders. On the whole, directors were treated absurdly well, and workers badly, and most industries were weakened by class suspicion and false economies and cynicism. But the same qualities that made English people seem stubborn and secretive made them, face to face, reliable and true to their word. I thought: The English do small things well and big things badly.
author: Paul Theroux, The Kingdom by the Sea
category: britain, character, class, english, industry, work

quote: Pick a side or create new one ! Otherwise be a coward or traitor.
author: Toba Beta, Betelgeuse Incident: Insiden Bait Al-Jauza

quote: A lake cannot remain stormy for a long time
author: an ocean cannot remain calm for a long time
category: everything and everyone cannot behave different from his own character for a long time!

quote: The severest test of character is not so much the ability to keep a secret as it is, when the secret is finally out, to refrain from disclosing that you knew it all along.
author: Sydney J. Harris

quote: You will know who truly loves you when you ask them to do an uncoventional favor.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
category: a-good-friend, ask, asking, benevolence, bond, character, discerning, disguise, favour, friendship, genuine, giver, givers, giving, help, helper, helping, love, magnanimity, michael-bassey-johnson, perception, plead, sensitive, sensitivity, spotting-out, true-friend, unconventional

quote: Once Addie let someone in, she was impossible to forget. There was something about her that crawled inside a person and built a nice comfy home there, her goodness expanding until it filled every limb.
author: Kasie West, Split Second

quote: Is it ok to sometimes be shy?Yes, of course. The point is,that being that way all the time and using it as an excuse to never be the opposite of shy,it's not good. It's not good for your life, your interactions,strenght of character and how diverse and interesting you can be. You are MORE than shy. Don't be labeled, be what you wanna be in any given moment. And DO what WORKS, not what you think you are.
author: Matthew Hussey
category: boring, character, conversations, interactions, life, shy

quote: The foundation stones for a balanced success are honesty, character, integrity, faith, love and loyalty.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: You need tell me nothing
author: I already know your heart. Through your simplest choices you've given yourself away.

quote: The telling of any character is what they do in a different situation.

quote: Perfection should generally be avoided in a character. Real people, such as your readers, aren’t flawless and chances are they are not going to be able to fully identify with a character who is.

quote: This is often the way we put together our lives, adding the striking qualities of others into our own character.
author: Renée Fleming, The Inner Voice: The Making of a Singer

quote: It's not the tailor that makes the man.
author: Romanian proverb

quote: Never underestimate the capacity of people to choose the easy way.
author: William James Moore, On Character and Mental Toughness

quote: IT’S NOT THAT ANYONE CAN BE A HERO, BUT THAT A HERO CAN COME FROM ANYWHERE. BUT THE KEY IS THAT THEY HAVE TO HAVE SOMETHING INSIDE THEM. A SPARK. A SENSE OF MORALITY. A YEARNING.
author: Film Crit Hulk!, Screenwriting 101 by Film Crit Hulk!

quote: It makes your buttocks ache walking on flat ground all the time.
author: Linda Proud, A Tabernacle for the Sun

quote: Please please read. Everything and anything. You may not remember all of it, you may not remember any of it But from the fairytailes...to the sweeping soaring classics I hope you will one day discover for yourself, all those words--those lives and characters, ideas and ideals--will, without you realising, shape you and sometimes even shelter you. And it shall be as if you have lived a thousand lives.
author: Amy Mowafi, Fe-mail 2

quote: When making the problem go away is more important than solving the problem leadership begins to fail. The easy way vs. The character way.
author: William James Moore, On Character and Mental Toughness

quote: In real life people do occasionally act out of character or do things we wouldn’t normally expect them to do. In fiction, there should be a good reason for a character to do something outside of the ordinary.
author: Craig Hart, The Writer's Tune-up Manual: 35 Exercises That Will Scrape the Rust Off Your Writing

quote: Alexia wondered what it said about her character that Ivy had genuinely believed she would intentionally go climbing about the side of a floating dirigible.
author: Gail Carriger, Changeless

quote: Victory, is like a boxer that hangs his gloves, after the consecutive losses; sometimes walking away is what builds character, than the actual fight. As humble fruit on a tree that falls to the ground and rots, never finding appreciation in the taste of mouths.
author: Anthony Liccione
category: appreciation, boxer, build, character, conquest, consecutive, destroy, enemy, fight, fruit, humility, lose, mouth, opponent, rot, struggle, success, sweetness, taste, tree, triumph, victory, walk-away, war, win

quote: In recalling my childhood I like to picture myself as a beehive to which various simple obscure people brought the honey of their knowledge and thoughts on life, generously enriching my character with their own experience. Often this honey was dirty and bitter, but every scrap of knowledge was honey all the same.
author: Maxim Gorky, My Childhood

quote: Your attitude defines your personality. Your personality refines your attitude. Together they make up your character.
author: Tanya Masse, Stairway to Awesomeness!: 30 Fundamental Steps to Living a Life of Awesomeness!

quote: There is a perfect rout of characters in every man—and every man is like an actor’s trunk, full of strange creatures, new & old. But an actor and his trunk are two different things
author: Wallace Stevens

quote: Life is like a painting you reflect the image based on your feeling, emotion, character, attitude and how you made it.
author: Daniel Habil
category: attitude, character, emotion, encouragement, feeling, image, inspirationa, life, painting

quote: If one abandons their principles when tested by struggle, they were never true principles but advertisements for character they never possessed.
author: Tiffany Madison
category: advertisement-and-attitude, character, character-description, character-development, character-quote, principles, principles-life, truth-of-life

quote: He is a man who kicks at cats, said Solembum, as if that summed up Tenga’s entire character.
author: Christopher Paolini, Brisingr

quote: There is no index of character as sure as the voice.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Character is less about what we do wrong And All about what we make right....
author: Navonne Johns

quote: Dickens enjoyed human beings as he found them, unregenerate, peculiar and incorrigibly themselves.
author: John N. Gray

quote: Bodily vigor is good, and vigor of intellect is even better, but far above both is character. It is true, of course, that a genius may, on certain lines, do more than a brave and manly fellow who is not a genius; and so, in sports, vast physical strength may overcome weakness, even though the puny body may have in it the heart of a lion. But, in the long run, in the great battle of life, no brilliancy of intellect, no perfection of bodily development, will count when weighed in the balance against that assemblage of virtues, active and passive, of moral qualities, which we group together under the name of character; and if between any two contestants, even in college sport or in college work, the difference in character on the right side is as great as the difference of intellect or strength the other way, it is the character side that will win.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Do not judge a man by where he stands, but how he reached there.
author: Raheel Farooq

quote: A man will will never know a woman until he knows her work.
author: Richard Llewellyn, How Green Was My Valley

quote: The measure of your character and mental toughness is the space between what you are doing and what you could be doing
author: William James Moore, On Character and Mental Toughness

quote: You express the truth of your character, your dedication to your goals, and your commitment to your relationships with the choice of your actions.
author: Steve Maraboli, Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: Maximus was my model for self-control, fixity of purpose, and cheerfulness under ill-health or other misfortunes. His character was an admirable combination of dignity and charm, and all the duties of his station were performed quietly and without fuss. He gave everyone the conviction that he spoke as he believed, and acted as he judged right. Bewilderment or timidity were unknown to him; he was never hasty, never dilatory; nothing found him at a loss. He indulged neither in despondency nor forced gaiety, nor had anger or jealousy any power over him. Kindliness, sympathy, and sincerity all contributed to give the impression of a rectitude that was innate rather than inculcated. Nobody was ever made by him to feel inferior, yet none could have presumed to challenge his pre-eminence. He was also the possessor of an agreeable sense of humour.
author: Marcus Aurelius, Meditations

quote: You see, Marcus, some things have value yet have no price, and a wise man learns them and their worth. So do not let the standard of the marketplace be your guide. A man goes there for flour and greens, but not for virtue.
author: Paul Waters, Of Merchants & Heroes

quote: By mastering character and plot, you give your book a fighting chance and withoutcharacter and plot, no book can survive.
author: Craig Hart, The Writer's Tune-up Manual: 35 Exercises That Will Scrape the Rust Off Your Writing

quote: Your NAME and your REPUTATION is ALL that you have, so GUARD them. They are worth more than money or gold.
author: L. Michelle

quote: Characters are the lifeblood of anygood book.
author: Craig Hart, The Writer's Tune-up Manual: 35 Exercises That Will Scrape the Rust Off Your Writing

quote: You can't guide someone into adulthood. The experiences are unique to each person. Deanna Troi
author: Star Trek: The Next Generation Episode Guide Team, STAR TREK: THE NEXT GENERATION EPISODE GUIDE: Details All 178 Episodes with Plot Summaries. Searchable. Companion to DVDs, Blu Ray and Box Set

quote: I am perhaps more proud of having helped to redeem the character of the cave-man than of any other single achievement of mine in the field of anthropology.
author: Henry Fairfield Osborn
category: achievements, anthropology, biology, cave-man, character, evolution, human-evolution, science

quote: Put character and mental toughness before execution and you will get consistent execution.
author: William James Moore

quote: We are dealing, then, with an absurdity that is not a quirk or an accident, but is fundamental to our character as people. The split between what we think and what we do is profound. It is not just possible, it is altogether to be expected, that our society would produce conservationists who invest in strip-mining companies, just as it must inevitably produce asthmatic executives whose industries pollute the air and vice-presidents of pesticide corporations whose children are dying of cancer. And these people will tell you that this is the way the "real world" works. The will pride themselves on their sacrifices for "our standard of living." They will call themselves "practical men" and "hardheaded realists." And they will have their justifications in abundance from intellectuals, college professors, clergymen, politicians. The viciousness of a mentality that can look complacently upon disease as "part of the cost" would be obvious to any child. But this is the "realism" of millions of modern adults.There is no use pretending that the contradiction between what we think or say and what we do is a limited phenomenon. There is no group of the extra-intelligent or extra-concerned or extra-virtuous that is exempt. I cannot think of any American whom I know or have heard of, who is not contributing in some way to destruction. The reason is simple: to live undestructively in an economy that is overwhelmingly destructive would require of any one of us, or of any small group of us, a great deal more work than we have yet been able to do. How could we divorce ourselves completely and yet responsibly from the technologies and powers that are destroying our planet? The answer is not yet thinkable, and it will not be thinkable for some time -- even though there are now groups and families and persons everywhere in the country who have begun the labor of thinking it.And so we are by no means divided, or readily divisible, into environmental saints and sinners. But there are legitimate distinctions that need to be made. These are distinctions of degree and of consciousness. Some people are less destructive than others, and some are more conscious of their destructiveness than others. For some, their involvement in pollution, soil depletion, strip-mining, deforestation, industrial and commercial waste is simply a "practical" compromise, a necessary "reality," the price of modern comfort and convenience. For others, this list of involvements is an agenda for thought and work that will produce remedies.People who thus set their lives against destruction have necessarily confronted in themselves the absurdity that they have recognized in their society. They have first observed the tendency of modern organizations to perform in opposition to their stated purposes. They have seen governments that exploit and oppress the people they are sworn to serve and protect, medical procedures that produce ill health, schools that preserve ignorance, methods of transportation that, as Ivan Illich says, have 'created more distances than they... bridge.' And they have seen that these public absurdities are, and can be, no more than the aggregate result of private absurdities; the corruption of community has its source in the corruption of character. This realization has become the typical moral crisis of our time. Once our personal connection to what is wrong becomes clear, then we have to choose: we can go on as before, recognizing our dishonesty and living with it the best we can, or we can begin the effort to change the way we think and live.
author: Wendell Berry, The Unsettling of America: Culture and Agriculture

quote: To keep any great nation up to a high standard of civilization there must be enough superior characters to hold the balance of power, but the very moment the balance of power gets into the hands of second-rate men and women, a decline of that nation is inevitable.
author: Christian D. Larson
category: balance-of-power, character, characters, civilization, decline, great, high-standard, inevitable, nation, superior

quote: Never permit circumstances to change your plans, but give so much character to your plans that they will change circumstances. Give so much character to the current of your work that all things will be drawn into that current, and that which at ﬁrst was but a tiny rivulet, will thus be swelled into a mighty, majestic stream.
author: Christian D. Larson
category: character, circumstances, majestic, mighty, permit, work

quote: The crisis of community has its source in the corruption of character.
author: Wendell Berry, The Unsettling of America: Culture and Agriculture

quote: Like your marriage, everything in the universe is trying to find its orbit. In the midst of this constant readjustment, both partners should be able to go to bed knowing that neither one is going to abandon a wounded, or struggling marriage. There is a comforting reassurance being with someone who keeps their promise.pg iv
author: Michael Ben Zehabe, Song of Songs The Book for Daughters
category: advice-to-daughter, character, christian-hypocrisy, covenant-keeper, faithful-wife, keeping-a-promise, loyal-husband, marital-advice, oath, promise-keeper, song-of-solomon, unfaithfulness

quote: If we are related, we shall meet. It was a tradition of the ancient world, that no metamorphosis could hide a god from a god; and there is a Greek verse which runs, "The Gods are to each other not unknown."Friends also follow the laws of divine necessity; they gravitate to each other, and cannot otherwise.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Emerson's Essays

quote: Men, I still think, ought to be weighed, not counted. Their worth ought to be the final estimate of their value.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: What we do when defeat stares us in the face is the real touchstone of character. But the very fact that success has time and again proved the means of awakening people to the knowledge of greater ability than they ever before dreamed they possessed, ought to hearten and encourage us to keep on no matter how often we fail. If we brace ourselves and continue to push forward we will ultimately win out. (From Everybody ahead, or getting the most out of life)
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: The rain began to fall harder, and it distracted him, but he tried to pull himself back because he felt on the verge of understanding something large and important. It seemed to him that this moment—the light and wind, the sweep of fields, the falling rain, the lowing cows, Leah’s form as it twisted to one side and then another—captured a sort of life that he longed for, a life of order and harsh beauty, and although this was his farm and his vision, it did not seem to be his life. It seemed instead to be the thing for which he must daily give up his life, an act of submission to something he could not name and only rarely, in moments such as these, have a sense of. Life during these moments seemed neither lost nor ruined but a power to be shared, as the grass shares its power with the living things that devour it.
author: Robert Boswell, Mystery Ride
category: character, duty, farming, life, love, purpose, rain, sharing, virtue

quote: Talking to Robespierre, one tried to make the right noises; but what is right, these days? Address yourself to the militant, and you find a pacifist giving you a reproachful look. Address yourself to the idealist, and you’ll find that you’ve fallen into the company of a cheerful, breezy professional politician. Address yourself to means, and you’ll be told to think of ends: to ends, and you’ll be told to think of means. Make an assumption, and you will find it overturned; offer yesterday’s conviction, and today you’ll find it shredded. What did Mirabeau complain of? He believes everything he says. Presumably there was some layer of Robespierre, some deep stratum, where all the contradictions were resolved.
author: Hilary Mantel, A Place of Greater Safety

quote: Reason is an outcome of frailty and resentment. When Will fails to cope with the labour of life, or the life of labour, its fragile remnants are set to construct a slighter world of justifications.
author: Raheel Farooq
category: character, justifications, logic, philosophy, reason, will

quote: Knowledge cannot be maintained without character.
author: Raheel Farooq

quote: If you want to become successful, then first become the person who can be successful.
author: SuccessCoach Nilesh, Go for Success: Be a Champion by 6 Effective Steps

quote: I used to take my morning tea at her kiosk and I took an interest in what she was doing. I later learnt she was taking care of her grandchildren. Sadly, she was taken ill and had to close her nylon-walled smoky shack. But all the wit and cunning of the character came from her.
author: Stanley Gazemba

quote: A man of fifty is responsible for his face.
author: Edwin McMasters Stanton

quote: It’s not our mistakes that define us. It’s the lessons we learn that show our true character.
author: Cassia Leo, Bring Me Home

quote: There is nothing in which people more betray their character than in what they find to laugh at.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe, Elective Affinities

quote: There are no verdicts to childhood, only consequences, and the bright freight of memory.
author: Pat Conroy, The Prince of Tides

quote: His characters are ravaged, beaten. They walk through infernos and emerge charred doves.
author: Marisha Pessl, Night Film

quote: When they know what makes you cry, they know what hurts you most. Don't give your enemies that." Solin, character in The Guardian by Sherrilyn Kenyon
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon, The Guardian
category: character, cry, enemies, harm, hurt, protect

quote: It's nice to be liked, but it's better to be respected.
author: Habeeb Akande
category: character, inspirational, integrity, motivational, respect, respect-yourself, value

quote: Life goes headlong. We chase some flying scheme, or we are hunted by some fear or command behind us. But if suddenly we encounter a friend, we pause; our heat and hurry look foolish enough; now pause, now possession, is required, and the power to swell the moment from the resources of the heart. The moment is all, in all noble relations.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, The Essays of Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: She's the main character in her story, just like I'm the main character in mine.
author: Marisa de los Santos, Love Walked In

quote: Life is a character-building opportunity that we all volunteered for.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: character, character-building, life, purpose-of-life, richelle, richelle-goodrich, volunteer

quote: Your talent and giftedness as a leader have the potential to take you farther than your character can sustain you. That ought to scare you.
author: Andy Stanley, Next Generation Leader: 5 Essentials for Those Who Will Shape the Future

quote: She had always wanted to do every thing, and had made more progress in both drawing and music than many might have done with so little labour as she ever would submit to... She was not much deceived as to her own skill either as an artist or a musician, but she was not unwilling to have others deceived, or sorry to know her reputation for accomplishment often higher than it deserved.
author: Jane Austen, Emma
category: character, characteristics, description, effort, motivation, talent

quote: I was tired of this silly joking about my 'speaking countenance'. I could keep a secret as well as anyone. Poirot had always persisted in the humiliating belief that I am a transparent character and that anyone can read what is passing in my mind.
author: Agatha Christie, Curtain

quote: There are many eyes that can detect and honor the prudent and household virtues; there are many that can discern Genius on his starry track, though the mob is incapable; but when that love which is all-suffering, all-abstaining, all-aspiring, which has vowed to itself, that it will be a wretch and also a fool in this world, sooner than soil its white hands by any compliances, comes into our streets and houses, --only the pure and aspiring can know its face, and the only compliment they can pay it, is to own it.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, The Essays of Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: To possess a rich life of wholeness that brings happiness into the soul
author: is to show loving and caring characteristic traits toward others.

quote: The road is long if one proceeds by way of precepts but short and effectual if by way of personal example.
author: Seneca, Letters from a Stoic

quote: If you don't demonstrate leadership character, your skills and your results will be discounted, if not dismissed.
author: Mark      Miller, The Heart of Leadership: Becoming a Leader People Want to Follow

quote: The vice president (Nixon) seems like a man who is acting like a nice man rather than being one.
author: Ann Whitman

quote: I was beginning to think that Simon just had a bad case of OCD, ADD, and PMS. With a little BS and OMG mixed in.
author: Dannika Dark, Gravity
category: add, bs, character, comical, dannika-dark, funny, humor, observation, ocd, omg, pms, pnr, romance, series, uf, urban-fantasy

quote: Leadership consists of nothing but taking responsibility for everything that goes wrong and giving your subordinates credit for everything that goes well.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: Every day people judge all other people. The question is whether they judge wisely.
author: Orson Scott Card, Xenocide

quote: He must shape simultaneously (in an expanding creative moment) his characters, plot, and setting, each inextricably connected to the others; he must make his whole world in a single, coherent gesture, as a potter makes a pot...
author: John Gardner, The Art of Fiction: Notes on Craft for Young Writers
category: character, plot, setting, story, writer, writing

quote: The unnamed should not be mistaken for the nonexistent.
author: Jean de La Bruyère

quote: The very essence of politeness is to take care that by our words and actions we make other people pleased with us as well as with themselves.
author: Jean de La Bruyère

quote: As our fathers said, you can tell a ripe corn by its look.
author: Chinua Achebe, Things Fall Apart

quote: Whatever makes an impression on the heart seems lovely in the eye.
author: Saadi

quote: He lost the great big outward thing, the good- looking package, and the real parts endured. They shine through like crazy, the brillian mind and humor, the depth of generosity, the intense blue yes, those beautiful hands.
author: Anne Lamott, Plan B: Further Thoughts on Faith
category: beauty, character, charismatic, inner, looks, mappereance, personality

quote: There are no perfectly honorable men
author: but every true man has one main point of honor and a few minor ones.

quote: Judge a person not by how he treats you, but how he treats others. The former reflects what he wants you to think of him, the latter truly reflects who he is.
author: Betty Jamie Chung

quote: You know, I'm like Avis rent-a-car: Because I'm insignificant, I try harder.
author: Mike Carey

quote: Ian was a good man—honest, trustworthy, loyal, and of honorable character. His desire to keep his promise to Angelle and to be a respectable servant of Harrowbeth would always take president over any personal feelings, no matter how intense or gratifying they might be. He would never betray Harrowbeth. He would never cheat Derian or Angelle. He would never deceive his queen, even if in so doing he would find a love and happiness they both longed to share. His commitment to what he saw as right meant more.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Eena, The Curse of Wanyaka Cave
category: character, eena, honor, ian, promises, richelle, richelle-goodrich, the-harrowbethian-saga

quote: There is no pressure to perform, to succeed, because we already have. If your family and community accepts you, who else must you impress? Just yourself and God, ja?
author: Sarah Price, Fields of Corn

quote: A chief cause of worry and unhappiness in life is trading what we want most for what we want at the moment.
author: Maralee McKee, Manners That Matter for Moms

quote: It is nice to be important but it is more important to be nice
author: Fela Durotoye

quote: Strength of character will carry you further than physical strength alone.
author: GamiRae

quote: The dysfunction was not the character of one person, it was the split of family by divorce, with the ripples felt for eternity by bloodline.
author: Amber Garibay

quote: Great men are strong men with great leadership qualities. They inspire others to be loving and caring like themselves. By this their character is made stronger.
author: Ellen J. Barrier

quote: Its not the content nor context,rather, its the character that masses heed to.
author: Arap yegon chitabkoret

quote: Some of us are always in the borderlands no matter where we might be on the map.
author: James Carlos Blake, Borderlands

quote: To obtain greatness and strength, a man must have a good character. He is honorable and respected by others. We define him as intelligent, and as one who God has blessed with wisdom
author: Ellen J. Barrier

quote: Individual effort is good but collective effort is better. We need a NETWORK of nation builders
author: Fela Durotoye

quote: For a Hero cannot triumph all the time. Sometimes he will be defeated, and how he faces that defeat is a test of his character.
author: Cressida Cowell, How to Steal a Dragon's Sword

quote: The Prophet's character was termed tremendous because his concern was for God alone.
author: Imam Junayd al-Baghdadi
category: character, islam, prophet-muhammad, prophetic-gift, religion, tasawwuf

quote: You’re noble enough, Baudelaires. That’s all we can ask for in this world.
author: Lemony Snicket, The Penultimate Peril

quote: You express the truth of your character with the choice of your actions.
author: Steve Maraboli, Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: What do you believe reveals more about a man’s character, his arrogance or his attempt to disguise it?
author: Aaron B. Powell, Quixotic

quote: If you give people a chance, they shine.
author: Billy Connolly, Billy Connolly's Route 66

quote: When someone says "I Love You," it is imperative that you know if you are loved for "WHAT you are" or "WHO you are." When the academic qualifications, professionals, positions, possessions, good look, fat bank accounts and all that has been acquired over the years are taken away, all that is left is "Who you are" - Your Personality (character, values, perceptions.)"We are never truly loved, until we are loved for WHO and not WHAT we are
author: Olaotan Fawehinmi
category: character, good-look, i-love-you, love, olaotan-fawehinmi, perceptions, personality, positions, possessions, values, what-we-are, who-we-are

quote: There was nothing fake or added about him. He was all himself.
author: Colin Cotterill, The Coroner's Lunch

quote: To test a man, determine how much it takes to make him lie.
author: C.J. Langenhoven

quote: Judge character by behavior.
author: Lizelle DuPlessis, Ethereal Revelations Volume I

quote: Confession: I don't want everybody to be beautiful, not in that unlined, creaseless, symmetrical way. Android beauty, like it comes out of a test tube. Beauty without blemish or mark. Not only do I not identify with such people, I don't believe in them either. I don't even find them attractive. This is what makes watching television so hard: they don't cast actors anymore, only models. When they make a movie of my life, they'd better cast a character actor in the lead. Don't try to tell me I'm not a character.
author: Lisa Samson, The Sky Beneath My Feet

quote: Cooperation is a higher moral principle than competition.
author: Bryant McGill, Voice of Reason

quote: Control thought-forms are the basis of our deepest moral crisis.
author: Bryant McGill, Voice of Reason

quote: If we think of the novel and the epic...The difference lies in the fact that the important thing about the epic is a hero--a man who is a pattern for all men. While, as Mencken pointed out, the essence of most novels lies in the breaking down of a man, in the degeneration of character.
author: Jorge Luis Borges, This Craft of Verse

quote: A well-developed and versed character will write the story for you.
author: A.R. Voss

quote: Character primarily is honesty with God, ones-self, and others."~R. Alan Woods [2013]
author: R. Alan Woods, The Journey Is the Destination: A Book of Quotes With Commentaries

quote: The character of Jesus can only be ultimately known experientially through the indwelling of His Spirit in union with us."~"The character of Jesus can only be ultimately known experientially through the indwelling of His Spirit in union with us."~R. Alan Woods [2013]
author: R. Alan Woods, The Journey Is the Destination: A Book of Quotes With Commentaries
category: character, character-defining, character-description, experientially, holy-spirit, incarnational, r-alan-woods, union-with-christ

quote: You can speak with spiritual eloquence, pray in public, and maintain a holy appearance... but it is your behavior that will reveal your true character.
author: Steve Maraboli, Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience
category: actions, behavior, character, holy, inspirational, spiritual

quote: But if Crake wanted her to stay longer on any given night, do it again maybe, she'd make some excuse—jet lag, a headache, something plausible. Her inventions were seamless, she was the best poker-faced liar in the world, so there would be a kiss goodbye for stupid Crake, a smile, a wave, a closed door, and the next minute there she would be, with Jimmy.
author: Margaret Atwood, Oryx and Crake

quote: A person's worth is measured by the worth of what he values.
author: Marcus Aurelius, Meditations

quote: Every man of character will have that character questioned. Every man of honor and courage will be faced with unjust criticism, but never forget that unjust criticism has no impact whatsoever upon the truth. And the only sure way to avoid criticism is to do nothing and be nothing.
author: Andy Andrews, The Traveler's Gift: Seven Decisions that Determine Personal Success

quote: One's character is set at an early age, son. The choices you make now will affect you for the rest of your life." He was quiet for a minute then dropped the curtain and said, "I hate to see you swim out so far you can't swim back.
author: Wendelin Van Draanen

quote: Everyone makes mistakes, but only a person with integrity owns up to them.
author: Nicole Guillaume

quote: Speak less and listen more.
author: Zai

quote: Just think how happy you'd be if you lost everything you have right now & then got it back.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: We are given talent but we choose to have character.
author: Wayde Goodall, Why Great Men Fall: 15 Winning Strategies to Rise Above It All

quote: ...I didn't want you flawless - I have a bare wall at home that's flawless - I wanted your character trapped in the amber of your skin...
author: John Geddes, A Familiar Rain

quote: First character, then ability.
author: Shinichi Suzuki, Nurtured by Love: The Classic Approach to Talent Education

quote: What if God doesn’t keep his promises?
author: K. Howard Joslin, Honest Wrestling

quote: Understanding character is a vital part of the process of finding a relationship partner and developing a strong and vibrant relationship together.
author: Susanne M. Alexander, Creating Excellent Relationships: The Power of Character Choices

quote: One uncontrolled character flaw can ruin your greatest accomplishment.
author: Wayde Goodall, Why Great Men Fall: 15 Winning Strategies to Rise Above It All

quote: Never let anyone get the worst of you. For you too will become just like them
author: Bradley Shutter

quote: Character is contagious.
author: Wayde Goodall, Why Great Men Fall: 15 Winning Strategies to Rise Above It All

quote: A tough hide with a tender heart is a goal that all leaders must have.
author: Wayde Goodall, Why Great Men Fall: 15 Winning Strategies to Rise Above It All

quote: The one surefire way to get me not to hire you is to send me your resume, especially if you've already got a good job. I won't be interested, because in a couple years, you'll be doing the same thing to me that you're doing to your current boss: looking for a better deal.
author: Bo Schembechler

quote: We largely become what we have observed and respected.
author: Wayde Goodall, Why Great Men Fall: 15 Winning Strategies to Rise Above It All

quote: ...if you're an actor, and you've thought your way into the part, then you're character portrayal will have authority...
author: John Geddes, A Familiar Rain

quote: Affronts to her reputation pierced her to the heart, though I couldn’t understand why, since she had very little character left to defend.
author: Melika Dannese Lux, Corcitura
category: character, corcitura, eric-bradburry, hypocrisy, logic, melika-dannese-lux, reputation, sorina-boroi

quote: There is no greater evil than men's failure to consult and to consider.
author: Sophocles, Antigone

quote: Encourage literally came from "in courage." The courage is put "into" you from outside. Our character and abilities grow through internalizing from others what we do not possess in ourselves.
author: Henry Cloud
category: character, character-defining, character-development, character-driven, character-quote, encourage, integrity, integrity-knowledge, quotes-to-live-by

quote: While your character flaws may have created mild problems for other people, they will create major problems for your spouse and your marriage.
author: Timothy J. Keller, The Meaning of Marriage: Facing the Complexities of Commitment with the Wisdom of God

quote: I am someone who has a cold heart. If I am beside a great grief I throw barriers up so the loss cannot go too deep or too far. There is a wall instantly in place, and it will not fall.
author: Michael Ondaatje, The Cat's Table

quote: Even pretty faces are mutilated by ugly character
author: أحمد عمارة

quote: No one does anything uncharacteristic of who they are.
author: Richard Bach

quote: I study men like I study books: I skim their midsections.
author: Bauvard, Some Inspiration for the Overenthusiastic

quote: A perfect character might be attended with the inconvenience of being envied and hated; and that a benevolent man should allow a few faults in himself, to keep his friends in countenance.
author: Benjamin Franklin, The Autobiography of Benjamin Franklin

quote: The fate of the country... does not depend on what kind of paper you drop into the ballot-box once a year, but on what kind of man you drop from your chamber into the street every morning.
author: Henry David Thoreau, Slavery in Massachusetts

quote: A hero without faults is like an omelet without little bits of eggshell in it.
author: Colin Cotterill, Love Songs from a Shallow Grave

quote: Hortense was a wife; Valerie a mistress.Many men desire to have these two editions of the same work, although it is proof of deep inferiority in a man if he cannot make his wife his mistress. Seeking variety is a sign of impotence.
author: Honoré de Balzac, Cousin Bette

quote: From out of your heart, you speak."-Emma, When Crickets Cry
author: Charles Martin, When Crickets Cry

quote: He was a character.A character who should still be here. Damn it all to hell.He should still be here.
author: Lisa Schroeder, Chasing Brooklyn

quote: The only thing you can take with you when you die is what you are. Character counts more than possessions.
author: Orrin Woodward, LIFE

quote: A character for steadiness once gone is not easily recovered
author: Thomas Hughes, Tom Brown's Schooldays

quote: In these times of Darkness, I keep dreaming of a better tomorrow, and praying my soul won't be corrupted." These are Gudrun's words and thoughts. She is living in a troubled world, where only the strong can be free.She is a Fantasy character you find on The Art of Isis Sousa & Guests!
author: Isis Sousa, Art of Isis Sousa & Guests: Fantasy Digital Painting Techniques & Video Lectures

quote: A man carries within him the germ of his most exceptional action; and if we wise people make eminent fools of ourselves on any particular occasion, we must endure the legitimate conclusion that we carry a few grains of folly to our ounce of wisdom.
author: George Eliot, Adam Bede

quote: I suppose that one’s years spent living do not reflect a measure of our souls or strength of character.
author: Peter Koevari, Prophecies Awakening

quote: What's in a name?  The accumulation of reputations from all who've owned it before you.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
category: character, distinction, names, regard, reputation, repute, richelle, richelle-goodrich

quote: Her flesh was powdery and voluptuously weary, as if tenderized by all the different beds and arms in which she had lain. Her face was as soft as the pulpy flash of an overripe banana, her breasts like two tiny bunches of grapes. She exuded a certain seedy charm, a poetry of premature corruption and decay. She breathed the air as if it burned her palate, baking her small, hot, whorish mouth. It was as if she were sucking a sweet or slurping champagne.
author: Dezső Kosztolányi, Skylark

quote: I'm starting to feel like a character from one of these books
author: Christina Tetreault, The Teacher's Billionaire

quote: Character is what we do when no one else is watching"~R. Alan Woods [2012]
author: R. Alan Woods, The Journey Is The Destination: A Photo Journal

quote: (Kindness) is much more a sign of character than mere niceness. Kindness connects to who you are, while niceness connects to how you want to be seen."-David Levithan (Every Day)
author: David Levithan

quote: In my opinion, too much attention to weather makes for instability of character.
author: Elizabeth Goudge, The Little White Horse

quote: Jealousy is a strange transformer of characters.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle, The Adventure Of The Noble Bachelor
category: attributes, change, character, jealousy, nature, transformation

quote: ...I've been ripped off, lied to, slandered, gossiped about slapped, falsely accused, and had my truths not believed. I've had my heart broken, had my pride stomped on, witnessed unforgivable acts, and heard words that hurt so much I withed that they would not replay in my head, but they did. In all these moments--some tear-soaked, some life-defining, but all character-building moments--I have felt vulnerable. And I believe these feelings of vulnerability--when a person feels scared and alone and overwhelmed and pissed off, wen the sting of unfairness bites deep--while miserable to live through, are the basis for writing compelling fiction.
author: Jessica Page Morrell

quote: Emma Willard told the legislature that the education of women "has been too exclusively directed to fit them for displaying to advantage the charms of youth and beauty" The problem, she said, was that "the taste of men, whatever it might happen to be, has made into a standard for the formation of the female character." Reason and religion teach us, she said, that "we too are primary existences...not the satellites of men.
author: Howard Zinn

quote: There is nothing in which people more betray their character than in what they laugh at.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Kind old ladies assure us that cats are often the best judges of character. A cat will always go to a good man, they say[.]
author: Virginia Woolf, Jacob's Room

quote: Would you have references?""I'm awfully sorry but I haven't. I just arrived in New York, and don't know a soul. Except you." I smiled but she didn't smile back. She stood hesitating, and I said, "It's true that I'm an escaped convict, an active counterfeiter, and occasional murderer. And I howl during the full of the moon. But I'm neat.
author: Jack Finney, Time and Again

quote: Realize that by hurting your own characters, you are not a sadist. You are not deliberately hurting your loved ones merely to watch them suffer. You’re giving a gift. You’re helping them grow and develop. Your characters take on deeper meaning to become more alive on your pages. They’ll become real.
author: James Chartrand

quote: No man engaged in a work he does not like can preserve many saving illusionsabout himself. The distaste, the absence of glamour, extend from the occupation to the personality. It is only when ourappointed activities seem by a lucky accident to obey the particular earnestness of our temperament that we can taste the comfort of complete self-deception.
author: Joseph Conrad, The Secret Agent

quote: A person’s authentic nature is a series of shifting, variegated planes that establish themselves as he relates to different people; it is created by and appears within the framework of his interpersonal relationships.
author: Philip K. Dick, The Selected Letters, 1972-1973

quote: Absolute power doesn't corrupt, but rather, reveals character.
author: Orrin Woodward

quote: People will follow you when you build the character to follow through.
author: Orrin Woodward

quote: I've always regarded it as a test of character to dislike the Kennedys. I don't really respect anyone who falls for Camelot.
author: Christopher Hitchens
category: american-politics, camelot, character, gore-vidal, kennedy-family, united-states

quote: It all goes so fast, and character makes the difference when it's close.
author: Jesse Owens

quote: Leaders do what ought to be done whether their deeds are known by thousands or known by no one.
author: Orrin Woodward

quote: Character is beyond obligation. You could kick your shoes off at the door, flick your cigarete butts onto the sidewalk or talk only in slang, those things are forgivable if you have character
author: Novala Takemoto, Missin' (Novel)

quote: What people say about you, good or bad, is not nearly as important as what you are.
author: Orrin Woodward

quote: He was all of those things, of course, but none of those things.
author: Marie Tillman, The Letter: My Journey Through Love, Loss, and Life

quote: People shouldn't be afraid of their government. Governments should be afraid of their people.
author: Alan Moore, V for Vendetta

quote: Sometimes I wonder whether the world is being run by smart people who are putting us on or by imbeciles who really mean it.
author: Laurence J. Peter, The Peter Principle

quote: A government big enough to give you everything you want is a government big enough to take from you everything you have.
author: Gerald R. Ford
